column4: hi everyone im having some problems with ubuntu 11.04, whenever i login on "ubuntu" session desktop/unity wont appear, ill just have desktop icons (shortcuts) while if i use ubuntu classic ill lose the applications menu (file edit and so on) is there any way to fix it? i can provide further details just ask-- just thought i have a nvidia 8200m G card, probably it helps
have you tries to go to additional drivers ?
yup, without drivers i have a warning (unity cant start) with drivers there is that problem, anyways with or without driver classic session wont give me applications menu
nvidia geforce 8200m G
try to clear out the mods through synptic then reinstall
did it i use PAE kernel, thought that it may be the issue so i tried with non PAE, still ending up there tho
is jockey-gtk installed ?
yes, i used it to get my drivers
the first time, second i tried from site but it was a bloodbath lol
i should try myself? lol
i made sure jockey ran with root privileges, in fact in apt log i have the drivers install entry, if thats what you want to achieve
what dmesg say
oddly enough on 10.10 unity would install and work, but mutter would kill my cpu lol (lil bug i suppose but it worked)
say about what?
what a modinfo
http://paste.ubuntu.com/607998/
looks good what about the modinf
i beg your pardon?
googling brb
is there a difference when running jockey in root at all?
not sure but you know "always try"
i did run with both privs and both installed stuff so id say there is no diff or probably jockey is set with suid lol
